item.title: Anthropic unveils custom AI models for U.S. national security customers
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Anthropic says that it has released a new set of AI models tailored for U.S. national security customers. The new models, a custom set of “Claude Gov” models, were “built based on direct feedback from our government customers to address real-world operational needs,” writes Anthropic in a blog post. Compared to Anthropic’s consumer- and enterprise-focused […]

item.title: The founder of DeviantArt is making a $22,000 display for digital art
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Angelo Sotira started the online digital art platform DeviantArt when he was just a teenager, growing a formative community for millions of artists in the 2000s. Twenty-five years later, Sotira wants to change digital art again, but with a focus on the way it’s displayed. On Thursday, Sotira revealed his new venture, Layer, a screen […]

item.title: X changes its terms to bar training of AI models using its content
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Social network X has changed its developer agreement to prevent third parties from using the platform's content to train large language models.

item.title: Toma’s AI voice agents have taken off at car dealerships – and attracted funding from a16z
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: When Monik Pamecha co-founded AI voice startup Toma in early 2024, he hadn’t anticipated spending the summer months sweating in Bible Belt car dealerships. He and co-founder Anthony Krivonos were still focused on banking and healthcare customers when the dealers came knocking.  “They just called us up and said ‘we are drowning in phone calls,’” […]

item.title: Collibra acquires data access startup Raito
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Collibra, a data governance platform based in Brussels, is the latest enterprise to acquire a data company in order to expand its offerings in the age of AI. On Thursday, Collibra announced its acquisition Raito, a data access startup founded in 2021. Raito, also located in Brussels, helps companies manage which employees and customers have […]

item.title: TechCrunch Sessions: AI launches in Berkeley today — here’s what you’ll miss if you’re not here
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Today’s the day! TechCrunch Sessions: AI is lighting up UC Berkeley’s Zellerbach Hall at 8 a.m. PT on the dot. The stage is set, the speakers are ready, and the AI community is gathering for one powerful day of insight, innovation, and momentum. Local to Berkeley and passionate about AI? There’s still time to join […]

item.title: Phone unlocking firm Cellebrite to acquire mobile testing startup Corellium for $170M
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Cellebrite said the deal will help with the "accelerated identification of mobile vulnerabilities and exploits."

item.title: Profitable African fintech PalmPay is in talks to raise as much as $100M
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: PalmPay, an African digital bank fintech, is in talks to raise between $50 million and $100 million in a Series B round, according to multiple sources familiar with the matter. It’s unclear what valuation it hopes to get, but its last round, in 2021, ranked it among the continent’s most valuable startups, estimated just shy […]

item.title: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai dismisses AI job fears, emphasizes expansion plans
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: In a Bloomberg interview Wednesday night in downtown San Francisco, Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai pushed back against concerns that AI could eventually make half the company’s 180,000-person workforce redundant. Instead, Pichai stressed the company’s commitment to growth through at least next year. “I expect we will grow from our current engineering phase even into next […]

item.title: North America takes the bulk of AI VC investments, despite tough political environment
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Despite what some experts have characterized as an environment increasingly hostile to AI R&D, North America continues to receive the bulk of AI venture dollars, according to data from investment tracker PitchBook. Between February and May of this year, VCs poured $69.7 billion into North America-based AI and machine learning startups across 1,528 deals. That’s […]

item.title: iOS 19: All the rumored changes Apple could be bringing to its new operating system
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: As Apple prepares to unveil iOS 19 at WWDC 2025 on Monday, several rumors have surfaced, including a potential new name for the operating system, an entirely new design inspired by the Vision Pro, and more.   Here’s a roundup of the most notable features rumored to be coming to iOS 19.  New name Sources […]

item.title: Hugging Face says its new robotics model is so efficient it can run on a MacBook
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: AI dev platform Hugging Face released an open AI model for robotics called SmolVLA, which the company claims outperforms much larger models for robotics in both virtual and real-world environments.

item.title: Ransomware gang claims responsibility for Kettering Health hack
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: A group of cybercriminals known as Interlock is advertising stolen data from Kettering Health, which includes patients’ data.

item.title: Reddit sues Anthropic for allegedly not paying for training data
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Reddit is suing Anthropic for allegedly using the site’s data to train AI models without a proper licensing agreement, according to a complaint filed in a Northern California court on Wednesday. Reddit claims in the complaint that Anthropic’s unauthorized use of the site’s data for commercial purposes was unlawful, and alleges the AI startup violated […]

item.title: Klarna CEO says company will use humans to offer VIP customer service
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski told the crowd at London SXSW that his company plans to balance employees and AI workers.

item.title: Unity CTO Steve Collins steps down after 6 months
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Steve Collins, the CTO of the game engine developer Unity, is stepping down.

item.title: AMD takes aim at Nvidia’s AI hardware dominance with Brium acquisition
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Brium is a startup that builds machine learning applications to enable AI inference, the process a trained AI model uses to draw conclusions from new data, across a variety of different hardware options.

item.title: Snap launches Lens Studio iOS and web apps for creating AR Lenses with AI and simple tools
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Snap has launched a stand-alone Lens Studio iOS app and web tool, the company announced on Wednesday. The new tools are designed to make it easier for anyone to create AR Lenses through text prompts and simple editing tools.

item.title: RevenueCat and Paddle team up to help app developers profit from web payments
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The companies announced a new integration that allows users to make purchases from developers' apps, whether on web or mobile devices.

item.title: Venmo introduces new debit card benefits and payment options as rival Cash App struggles
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: On Wednesday, Venmo debuted several new debit card benefits and expanded the ability to make payments with retailers such as TikTok Shop and Uber. The updates signal Venmo is trying to become more of a full-service fintech service, not just a peer-to-peer payments app.
